Reviews.Title: “OK, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Elit0m
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite large, with a heigh ceiling.mMy room had just been painted, which helped. The floors are wooden, a great plus. The pillows are dreadful and the beds a bit short, and the noise from the street is terrible. There are only two lifts so at the breakfast peak hour do take an extra 5 minutes if you are in a rush. There's free wifi in the lobby and it works well.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: Good location and a very pleasant walk up to the Major Plaza. Great little shops to check out on the way. Pillows are dreadful but breakfast was very nice with a great selection. Rooms are reasonable and as a triple share we have plenty of room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: howardform
Reviews.Content: This hotels has one of the BEST locations in Madrid, Its basically across the street from both the Atocha train station and the Prado Museum (5 Min walk to either) After taking the train from barcelona We were able to save Metro or Cab fare to the Hotel, there is also a 5 Euro Bus to the Airport from the Train station so you can walk to the bus and save on cabs to and from the Airport. The Metro is around the corner so its super convienent. Wifi was free in the room, I have to get a paper every 24 hours. Even though it was in the Atocha traffic circle, the room was quiet There is no pool, Hot Tub or Fitness center The rooms are small but the staff is great

Reviews.Title: “nh nacional madrid”
Reviews.Author: RajatBMumbai (Bombay)
Reviews.Content: nice hotel. short walk from the madrid main station. some of the sightseeings are along the road. there's a hop-in-hop-off bus stop right outside the hotel. rooms are comparitively smaller. had a impression of a hotel in the middle of lot of traffic as its near to the main station, but the area is pretty good. overall a nice stay. nice team.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: Ed_WallaceKitchener
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel due to its proximity to Atocha train station which was a 10-15 minute walk. It is also near museums such as the Prado. The room was neat and tidy, if a little small - ours looked down on a glass ceiling which I believe was the roof of the lobby. No internet in room, unless you pay, but free in the lobby. At first we couldn't figure out how to turn on any electrical devices, then was informed by front desk that we had to insert the room card into a slot! McDonalds is very near if you don't want to buy breakfast which is somewhat expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great affordable location for museums and transportation”
Reviews.Author: Zinserzoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple days to pick up my daughter. This hotel was a a great location for the museums, park and a walking tour of the city. The express bus from the airport drops you off within a block of this hotel. The room was average size, but very clean and neat. No wifi in your room, but down in the lobby or go to McDonald's to access wifi right next door. This was the cheapest hotel I had booked in Europe, but definitely worth it's value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, opposite the Prado Art Gallery”
Reviews.Author: KatieLB
Reviews.Content: Good hotel with a great location opposite the Prado and within walking distance of a Metro stop. McDonalds is next door which is great for breakfast if you do not eat in the hotel which was pretty expensive. Rooms are what you would expect from a 4 * hotel but are nothing special and we thought the room we stayed in was a bit dark and gloomy. Overall a good base within walking distance of many of the main attractions and there are loads of nice bars and restaurants on the doorstep so you don't have to walk too far at night. If you are looking for slick modern decor and great facilities rather than a good base to explore from, you may want to look at alternatives, although they will probably be a lot more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ArtistGirl68
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, central, and a great room. We have a preferential room which is large, clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom is large and pretty. Bathrobe adn slippers, etc The bath amenities smell great. The staff is actually friendly. The bed is comfortable. The walk here from Atocha was easy. The lobby has free wifi if you ask for a password at the desk, but it expires every half hour. I will be coming back over and over.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: mare1126
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and enjoyed the location and the hotel. We upgraded to a "premium" room for not much more money -- our room had a nice little hallway / entryway between the bath and the bed, which I appreciated. Everyone we encountered was helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Found a winner”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Here's what we liked about the NC Nacional. Great location: Can walk to the Prado in a few minutes and also to Atocha Station for trains south. Taxis always available right outside. Plaza Mayor is a 20-25 minute walk. Our Superior room cost 480 Euros for 3 nights. Very spacious and clean. Staff friendly. Can buy delayed checkout by the hour which is great when you departing that evening. Very good breakfast buffet. They'll cook your eggs to order! We'd go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, plastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Even with the best of locations, this hotel manages to make a stay feel like a visit to a plastic factory. Everything is reduced to absolute basics, but charged a designer price. My last visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as we needed to drop our car at Europcar, Atocha Station. This worked well as we pulled into their garage to leave our suitcases and then drove to nearby Atocha. The 8 lane road with barricaded bus/taxi lane outside was a bit daunting and backing out of the garage to allow an exiting car to come out was tricky! It is also handy for the 3 main museums, the botanic garden, Retiro Park and plenty of places to eat and drink. Our room was very small and quite noisy, even with the shutter down. I was surprised to get a room on the lowest floor despite having booked in February. The bath, toilet and bidet are screened from the basin area by a sliding frosted glass door but there is an additional door between the bed area and the bathroom. Ithink we were quoted about 22 euro each, extra for breakfast but 16euro each if we booked in advance. We had coffee and toast and juice for 3 euro just up the road. Internet is free for half an hour in the lobby. They were happy to store our cases in a fairly secure area on the day we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean smart decor, superlative breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TomZunder
Reviews.Content: Excellently placed for my business meeting, this turned out to be excellently placed for art galleries, parks, the rail station and the city tour bus. The English language skills of reception were weak but hey, my Spanish is non existent. Nice coffee machine in room. But the JOY is the redesign of breakfast as a work of healthy, stimulating and artistically pleasing experience as well as excellent food. I commend them for rethinking the hotel buffet breakfast and offering real choice and art. (yes, you can still eat your normal breakfast, but their is more to it than ever.)

Reviews.Title: “Good location perfect for any length of visit.”
Reviews.Author: Keith A
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for visiting the three great art galleries of the city. The food and service at breakfast are good in the pleasant light dining room. The coffee shop and bar in the foyer are convenient and good value if you don't feel like going further for refreshment. Our room was spacious with a well appointed bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “a good choice - great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Paula_Dublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good choice for business or pleasure. We were a couple but travelled with family also staying in the hotel. The airport bus takes you to the Atocha station for €5 and takes about 20 mins off peak. The location of this hotel is great - just about 3 minutes walk from the Atocha train station and within walking distance to most places of interest. We like walking around cities exploring but if that isn't your thing taxis are very reasonable only afew euros to most places. The Botanic Gardens and Retiro park are a stone's throw away. We discovered you can walk straight though the Retiro Park to one of the busier parts of town housing some really nice restaurants and bars. Close to the hotel there are plenty of nice restaurants. The hotel and surrounding for me felt quite safe. The rooms are not large but they are very comfortable and clean with air conditioning, tv, lockers, wardrobe and writing desk. The bathroom / shower room are separate from the bedroom which I personally like. When you enter the room you have a nice large washbasin and mirror area with a toilet / shower room off that, there is a door separating this area from the bedroom. The shower is very good and the toiletries are really nice here. Pleasingly there is a good hairdryer (better than normal hotel standard hairdryer) in the room so no need to bring your own. The breakfast here is fantastic huge range of cereals, fruit, hot breakfast made to order, breads, pastries, juices and the best of it is the freshly ground coffee. The only negative I have is that I ordered poached eggs on the last day and they took a long time to arrive and were overcooked. The sleep quality for me was very good - we did have a room at the front of the hotel but I didn't have any problem with noise the shutters are really good and kept the room quiet and kept the light out so we slept right through till 9 or 10 which was great. I found the Staff very helpful and knowledgeable, they were friendly and happy to help with queries or if you need suggestions, directions or help with transport. There is free wifi in reception only and you pay in the room for wifi but there is plenty of seating in reception if you need to sit down on internet for a while. Finally there's a McDonalds right next door also with free wifi too. please click if you think this review was helpful :) thanks

Reviews.Title: “Good location, messed up reservation”
Reviews.Author: Pantaleia
Reviews.Content: I found NH Nacional to be a disappointment. But let me first point out its strong points. The hotel is perfectly located across the street from Prado Museum, the rooms are on the small side but clean and well appointed. Breakfast is varied and the staff working in the breakfast room are kind and helpful. I would have been satisfied with the hotel had we not received such poor treatment. We arrived at the hotel past midnight, tired from 2 flights, expecting to meet friends we had not seen for a year, dying to lie down, only to be informed that somehow our reservation (made in January!) had been lost and there was no room available for us. A receptionist who barely spoke English and who I doubt understood even half of what we said to him tried to explain what had happened with an IT breakdown. We were told (with little or no regret) that we had to go to another hotel for the night and come back the next day. I somehow had the impression that these people thought that as long as they offered us alternative accommodation everything was ok. It was not. Firstly, my friend is of limited mobility and she was exhausted from being wheeled around 3 airports between the flights. Moreover, the hotel we were sent to had stairs leading to its entrance and these were simply too much for her. Secondly, we were meeting friends who live in the USA and Canada in Madrid for our annual reunion and they too were staying in NH Nacional. Obviously this was very inconvenient for us. What they did for us was reimburse us for the taxi to the other NH hotel at 2 am and the taxi back to NH Nacional the next morning; we were given a bigger room for our second and third night (looked small until we saw how small our friends’ room was), a free bottle of water and some sweets…The manager came to speak to my friend to apologize in person. Little consolation, in my opinion, especially when you have in mind that we did pay for all three nights. I am not sure I would stay there during my next trip to Madrid. If you choose to stay there, make sure you confirm your reservation with them a couple of times. One last word of warning: there’s a very big and very popular night club in the basement of the building. The noise is unbearable, more so if your room faces that side of the building – even with the blinds down!

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Central, Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jamibart
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night last week. I'd gotten virtually no sense of Madrid from guide books--most of their recommendations overlap and are sold out--but the folks at Trip Advisor directed me to the NH Nacional and it was a stroke of genius. We needed to walk to the train station the following morning, but didn't want to miss out on museums and restaurants, and for us the hotel was easily in walking distance of everything. The neighborhood is safe, beautiful and clean, the hotel staff was great about getting us right into our room at 9am after our long flight, the view from the room was stunning, the room was large, clean, quiet, elegant, the bed was comfortable, the lobby wireless was free, and the breakfast was great. I hardly ever write reviews, but this place was a gem. Don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Coffee!”
Reviews.Author: Bakerblog
Reviews.Content: Room was comfortable and location ideal and within easy walk from Atocha Station. The breakfast buffet was quite extensive but the water for the tea was lukewarm and there was no hot milk for the coffee which was also lukewarm. Reception staff very good. The road noise is bad, but central Madrid is noisy everywhere so the hotel location makes up for that. Good value generally.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: charmerScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for 4 nights. Check in was quick. Staff friendly and helpful. Room was small and had no window. Overlooked a small courtyard if you could call it that. Therefore very poor light and not sufficient lighting inside the room. No traffic noise but noisy from people moving along corridors. Otherwise room was very clean and had everything we needed. The location is perfect for all the major sights, metros and train station.

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS GOOD CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: actually i have been booked to stay again at the hotel but unfortunately the trip have cancelled, but sure I'll back to NH grand palace soon. I like my room, location and the view so much.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in the center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: stefano32
Reviews.Content: The position of the hotel is perfect for visiting the center of Madrid, all the main attactions are at walk distance and Prado is just in Front. The rooms are not to big but well furnished and new. Internet cnnection is not perfect and a litthe bit expensive. Breakfast is good and the hotel is well managed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with NH quality standards”
Reviews.Author: Amore64
Reviews.Content: The hotel occupies a historic building dating back to 1920, overlooking Paseo del Prado and the Botanical Garden, but it has been recently refurbished. The room we had was clean with a good king-size bed. We asked for an interior room, since the hotel is located on Paseo del Prado, with heavy traffic, and we were afraid that it would be too noisy. I must say that room soundproofing worked well and the room was very quiet. As for the bathroom, they could have taken advantage of the improvement works and change the bath tub for a modern shower. Apart from that, everything is fine, with good quality amenities. I booked directly with the hotel and got the Organizers fare, which is very convenient, though breakfast is not included. But there are numerous cafes and bars nearby where you can get the same type of breakfast at a fraction of the cost. Hard to find any better location, especially if you are travelling with the High Speed Train (AVE), just across Glorieta Carlos III and close to the three most important museums in Madrid: Thyssen Bornemisza, El Prado and Centro Reina Sofía. Caixa Forum Madrid is just around the corner. It’s also within walking distance to all main attractions. Anyway, there is a metro station just a few meters from the hotel. Staff at the reception was friendly, though a bit slow. Definitely, a very good choice in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: billerm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right near the three main museums, across the botanical gardens and near the park. It is more of a business hotel than a tourist hotel. Therefore the staff doesn't really know much about what is going on in the city or types of recommendations for restaurants. If you stay here, ask for a room on the inside as others are really noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, brilliant breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: We got the yellow airport bus (2Euros) from the end of the taxi rank to the main Atocha station, which is just across an intersection from the hotel. The Reina Sofia gallery was across the road and the Prado and Thyssen were on the same road as the hotel. Buses into town went from just around the corner. The metro station is also across the road. You could go anywhere in the city or Spain from this hotel. We slept well in a quiet clean room at the back on the fifth floor. We spent very little time in there because there was so much to see in Madrid. The breakfast was superb with freshly ground coffee, freshly squeezed juices and a buffet of fruit, meats, cheeses, bread, cereals, yogurt, pastries,cake and you could also order a cooked breakfast. It was the middle of the afternoon before we felt hungry! Our favourite restaurants were La Plateria and El Diario- both good value. All the staff at the hotel were efficient and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Don ask for quiet room!”
Reviews.Author: frack77
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for location and price. After reading reviews we asked for a quiet room instead of the out facing rooms on the street. Instead what we got for 6 nights, was a room facing a wall on the 6th floor, room 631. Ok, small but clean, seemed quiet. Well around 11:00 till 4:00 am the roof next door opens up and is a disco club. At times I could smell cig smoke in my room from the club. You would think the hotel would know that! On another note, check out the tapas at Taberna Txakolina, you won be dissapointed. You can walk around and pick out what you would like and very good waitresses that spoke english. The stuffed mushrooms on the weekend are so yummy! Rick Steves needs to review this place.Great for tourists that have trouble with spanish or prefer to see real, fresh food to make your selections. Also, Mirandas, or the sign outfront says Tapas and Cava, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Museums”
Reviews.Author: Etranger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at NH Nacional for three nights at the end of March. I chose this hotel primarily because of its proximity to the Prado Museum. If you are a museum lover like me, the Nacional is at an excellent location--Madrid's main art collections like the Prado, the Thyssen-Bornemisza, the Reina Sofia, are all within walking distance. Also it is easy to get to the hotel from Madrid Barajas airport. Take a yellow Airport Bus from outside Terminal 2. At the cost of 2 euros it takes you to Atocha station, from where the hotel is several minutes' walk (The bus actually passes in front of the hotel). Some reviewers complained of the noise from the street. My room faced onto the busy Paseo del Prado, but since it was on the seventh floor, the noise was no problem as long as I kept the window shut. My room was small but clean and had a little balcony. My main complaint is the price of breakfast. It costs 22 euros--far too expensive for the sort of buffet you would expect of a hotel of this category, though it gets slightly cheaper if you book it at the time of check-in. I will probably stay at this hotel again on my next visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, lousy sleeping”
Reviews.Author: FJQ77
Reviews.Content: The breakfast buffet is really good. The location is ok, too, if you don't mind walking a bit - or taking the metro. The quality of sleeping was bad. After 4 nights we are fed up with the bed and the terrible climate in the room: too warm, with airco on too dry air. Glad to be going home!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to all major sights in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel from time we entered the lobby. All employees, trom the front desk to the restaurant staff, were friendly and accommodating. We were a party of four and we had excellent service. The rooms were clean and well appointed; despite facing Paseo del Prado, a major street, we had no noise from traffic. The location is just blocks from the train station Atocha (for the AVE) and major museums, including the Prado, Thyssen, Reina Sifia; steps from metro; and walking distance to restaurants/tapa bars. We would definitely recommend this hotel and stay again when we are in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Business reviews”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Very much advised against getting a room against the street. Very very noisy. Most nights I could not sleep. Location was acceptable as there were parks and restaurants near by. Taxi services was just outside. Breakfast was very good. Lack of English spoken at the restaurant cause some difficulties. If I had a quieter room I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top central location with a perfect breakfast”
Reviews.Author: joabau
Reviews.Content: - Breakfast with a lot of different fresh fruits, like pineapple, melon, orange, kiwi - Location central, near to the city and to the Prado - Rooms are nice, best rooms are to the inner courtyard - Perfect and friendly service - No free WIFI in the rooms, approx. 10€/ day, free WIFI only in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and grand looking hotel on the Paseo del Prado”
Reviews.Author: EU27Traveller
Reviews.Content: A centrally located and impressive looking hotel on the Paseo del Prado. It is just 5 minutes walk from Atocha train station and metro which is also the arrival and departure stop for the airport bus (excellent value at 2 euros). The hotel is ideally situated opposite the botanical garden and just a short walk to the Prado Museum and other art galleries and museums. The historical heart of old Madrid with Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor and lots of restaurants, cafes and shops are within a 10-15 minute walk. Reception staff were friendly and spoke good English and checking in and out was quick and efficient. The hotel is situated on a busy road but my room on the 5th floor was inward facing and I heard no traffic noise (the downside was the view from the windows was other rooms but as I was out during the day that didn’t matter!). My room was clean and warm, the bed was comfortable and there was a small television and a well-stocked mini-bar. The only disappointment was the lack of tea and coffee making facilities – however these were available in the lobby area. The lobby area is spacious with sofas and tables and chairs and there is a small bar serving meals, drinks and coffee etc. The breakfast buffet has a good selection of cereals, fruit, pastries, breads, ham and cheese etc, teas and coffee (hot dishes can be ordered separately) and is served in a pleasant room on the first floor overlooking the plaza and Atocha station. A perfectly acceptable and nice 4 star hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable & affordable”
Reviews.Author: Margie091
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights ago, after an unplanned trip to Madrid from Barcelona, meaning we arrived at 9pm without a hotel room. My husband and I walked north from the Atocha RENFE station, looking for a hotel. After passing a couple of dodgy looking ones, we found this very nice hotel on the north-east corner of the large plaza 800 metres from the railway station, at the corner of Paseo del Prado and Calle de Atocha, above a McDonald's restaurant. We did not know it at the time, but it was just 200 metres south of the Prado Museum, which is further along the same street, on the other side of the road. It is also only two blocks north of the Raina Sofia art museum. We were so relieved to find a lovely double room with comfortable king single mattresses on a king base, and great pillows. Also pleasant service from the staff on the desk, who were happy to show us the room. There is free wi-fi for 30 mins in the reception area, as well as a bar, and a solitary computer for hire as well, which is fairly expensive but handy if you're desperate. The breakfast was also not not cheap, but was so good that it was worth every euro cent. It was late January, so the rooms may have been heavily discounted at 105 euros. There is a metro station (also called Atocha) just across the road from the hotel on the same plaza. That metro station is on line one, the pale blue line, and this line takes you directly north up through the centre of Madrid. A single ticket costs only 1.50 euros, also excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “NH Nacional - Great Locale, Clean, Best Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Susan P
Reviews.Content: We loved the location for this hotel - hop on a bus just outside the door or grab a bite at the Museo del Jamon just up the street. Train station is very close and the Prado is walking distance from the hotel. Many restaurants nearby and the Museo Reina Sofia is right around the corner. This is a big city and the Nacional is in one of many different neighborhoods - will try another neighborhood if we get back to Madrid but would recommend this if this is the area you're interested in. We especially looked forward to breakfast at a window table just to watch the city waking up and bustling off to work.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location.”
Reviews.Author: Tim H
Reviews.Content: Did I say location? Located on Paseo del Prado near the three major museums in Madrid. Atoche train station is within a 5 minute walk and the Atoche Metro station is one block away. Plenty of restaurants nearby as well as the Parque del Buen Retiro. Rooms at the NH are certainly small, but I had a roof top balcony with french doors that extended the space. Very clean and quiet for me. Staff was pleasant, too. Had difficulty with WIFI, as did others in the lobby. Quick reminder. Express bus from airport to Atoche train station is only 2 Euro. Best deal to move from airport to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff, Modern Room”
Reviews.Author: mrssarahsterling
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night only, the first night of our honeymoon, before venturing to other parts of Spain. We arrived at 3 hours before the check in time noted on our reservation, but they got a room for us right away. We were very appreciative of this, having just come off a 7.5 hour flight. The staff was helpful with giving us guidance for how to get places, and even provided a map of Madrid with landmarks on it for reference. As mentioned by another reviewer, it walkable to and from Atocha station, which is where we came in from the airport. It is also walkable to the Plaza Mayor and the Mercado San Miguel, among other places. The room and accompanying bathroom are modern and sleek. Note: This is NOT a good area to have a car. Public transporation and walking are highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast; small noisy room”
Reviews.Author: KC2SF
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for walking to the Prado, Reina Sofia and Thyssen museums and Retiro Park. Just a little further walk brings you to the Plaza Mayor and the Plaza del Sol, wonderful places for shopping and eating. The Atocha Metro station is just across the street if you are inclined to explore the city via public transportation. The front desk was very helpful and suggested a wonderful little restaurant off the beaten path. The buffet breakfast was outstanding with a variety of choices to appeal to any nationality, delicious fresh fruit, and the best tea bar I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “NH Nacional - Great location to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: hmojadidi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NH Nacional. Fantanstic location since it was close to everything we wanted. Within 5 minuted walking distance: Prado Museum, main train station (took a day trip to Toledo), Botanical Gardens, Retiro Park, great local restaurants, all within walking distance. Breakfast buffet was fantastic. Staff very nice and helpful. Recommend it 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Atocha station, Jardin Real, El Retiro”
Reviews.Author: Corwin24
Reviews.Content: Excellent buffet breakfast with plenty of wonderful choices. Just superb. Internet costs 70 Euros per week. In hotel laundry prices are breathtaking - who wants to pay 11 Euros to wash one pair of pants or one skirt. There is a laundry drop off service 6 blocks away that will do a whole load in less than 24 hours for 9 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great central location”
Reviews.Author: carriedo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been remodeled recently, and it's located just steps from the Atocha train station where you can take the bullet train to many touristic places along the coast of Spain at lighting speed, including Barcelona, Cadiz (Andalusia), and many more. It's across the street from the Retiro Park, short walk from the Puerta del Sol, and Old city center (Madrid de los Austrias). When we visited Madrid we stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. It's very stylish, well decorated and comfortable. We had breakfast and it was buffet style, and there were many food choices. But if you are not very hungry in the morning I would suggest that you go to a nearby cafe since it was a little bit expensive, unless it is included in the room price. We had a room with views of the Botanical Garden across the street, and it was spectacular! I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “OK BUT NOISY”
Reviews.Author: Peter C
Reviews.Content: We recently stopped for six days at the NH Nacional. We chose it because it was near the Prado, Riena Sofia and Thyssen art galleries and Atocha station. It was very conveniently located. From the airport it is easy to reach - change at Nuevos Ministerios and again at Cuatro Caminos. A 7-day tourist metro ticket cost €25 (good value). The hotel is on a busy street. It is modern, clean and reasonably priced. The ambiance is not impressive. It obviously caters for busy people who are not interested in luxury. The lobby area and bar are not the sort of places where you would want to chill out with a drink, or meet people. The bedrooms are OK, but nothing special. They are well-serviced. The hotel is a pleasant and interesting walk to Sol (the centre of Madrid) via the busy tourist haunt of the Plaza Santa Ana. Atocha station is a short distance away - great if you want to visit Toledo. DOWN SIDE The NC Nacional is the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed at. We were on the 8th floor. Directly outside our bedroom window was a huge arched roof. It rolls back to reveal a night club. The partying commences at 12.00 and goes on until 5.30am - well, the Spanish don't eat until very late. Sleep, even with ear plugs, was very difficult. On looking out of the window you could see the kids drinking and dancing and generally having a great time. Personally, when I am in my bedroom at 5.00am I prefer to sleep instead of watch teenagers and twenty-somethings partying. VALUE FOR MONEY Poor if you value sleep. We prefered to have breakfast at the Museo de Jamon a few doors away. It was cheap, excellent coffee, terrific jamon etc and it felt like we were in Spain. We will not be using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sweens_83
Reviews.Content: I requested a room on a high floor due to previous reviews re noise. The room was quiet, clean and more than adequate. The location was fantastic: 100m from major train station (direct bus from airport), 50m from tube station, 10m from tourist bus stop and right next to museum precinct/botanical gardens (which were amazing). Staff fluctuated from kind of rude to very friendly but I generally didn't have many dealings with them. Overall a pretty good value hotel in a fantastic spot.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!”
Reviews.Author: TexasBjb
Reviews.Content: For not knowing anything about Madrid & basing all our decisions on TripAdvisor/internet info, we believe we made quite a good choice staying at the NH Nacional . It's an attractive old hotel and its location couldn't have been more convenient. It is located across from the Botanical Gardens & is close to all 4 major museums & , as well as the Atocha Renfe station & the Atocha Metro stop. It is also within walking distance to most of the other major attractions, including Retiro Park, the royal palace, & the major plazas---but the metro system is cheap & efficient if you don't feel like walking. Our room was quite spacious (as European hotel rooms go), & the hotel staff was courteous & helpful. We did not include the breakfast buffet, which we thought was a little pricey, but there are plenty of nice places to eat close by---including our favorite, the Museo de Jamon. There was a coffeemaker but no coffee our first day; one room phone didn't work (but there were 2); and the free internet usage was limited, but overall we had a very enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “OK for a Business Visit”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler68926
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 14-17 June 2011. The room was of adequate size for abusiness stay. My room was situated directly over the street so it was a bit noisy. There is a park across the street where you can walk/run or just sit and enjoy. The train station that was bombed by terrorists in 2004 is in walking distance and a memorial for the lives lost is across from the station. Other historical sights are nearby as well and it is a pretty area to stroll through. There are several restaurants in walking distance and as I was there during fairly decent weather, I sat outside and enjoyed the food. There are various choices and you can choose almost any type food you enjoy: seafood, American favorites, spanish favorites, chinese, whatever. The staff and service at the hotel was "ok" but nothing exceptional. I had quite a scare at check out as they kept running my credit card and it keot coming back rejected. when I called BOA they said there was no record of any transactions had been attempted on my card. Eventually, a female manager swiped the card and it worked just fine (of course only a female could have figured it out - lol). I think location is good, the food was average - nothing to shout about, room service selection is minimal. As is typical outside of USA, internet is extremely overpriced, >$25 USA fo 24 hours. Taxis are always available if you don't want to walk or take the bis or train. I don't use trains, buses and/or subways so I can't speak to them. I would recommend the hotel as it has an inviting lobby anc clean rooms. Oh, bring face cloth and iron. There are no iron/ironing board at thiss hotel and they charge to press clothes for you. I needed my slacks and a blouse pressed for work the next day and they told me it would be 50% more to do it in less than 24 hours so I said "Forget that" and slipped into one of my spandex dresses. If it wasn't for the internet, lack of ironing ability and poor room service selections, I probably would have given this hotel 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, but good cafe next door”
Reviews.Author: HP14
Reviews.Content: There's a McDonalds on the ground floor, not quite in the hotel but in the building. It would be cruel to say that's the high point of the hotel, I thought that the Mueso del Jamon on the other side was far better, with great jamon and tapas. Its breakfast, a fresh coffee and croissant with jamon was great and was a tenth the price of the NH's overpriced offering. I'd left it late and rather than get a bargain, prices seem to have gone up as it got closer to leaving - this seemed to be the best place available for E100 a night. It was no more than passable. Room was small - with no chair other than the one at the desk and the decor was tied. Reception too was dated and as breakfast was so expensive, as was the sole computer terminal, there was no reason to use any part of the hotel other than the room so it was a bit of a hutch. Location was good, if not overly convenient for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel but nothing more”
Reviews.Author: guy47_10
Reviews.Content: centrally located hotel on a busy street; neighberhood not very attractive; small but comfortable room even when the airco/heating could not been set off. Good breakfast in a restaurant room that is to small to receive all the guests. Reception OK.

Reviews.Title: “BUSY INTERSECTION”
Reviews.Author: PeterToronto
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located at a very busy intersection and it would be adviseable to get a room on a higher floor not facing the street. Rooms are clean but spartan. It wouldn't make 4* rating in North America. But location is very good. Staff does speak to much English, but they try to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but be very specific with what you want, when you book a room...”
Reviews.Author: JRParente
Reviews.Content: At first, when we arrived to the hotel, I was really pleased with the location, and the beautiful lobby of the hotel. It is beautifully decorated; it has a huge TV in the lobby, and a really nice bar. However I was really disappointed when I got to the room. It looked nothing like I had seen online, and I hadn't read any description of such a room. It was an extremely small and dark room, decorated in really dark tones, and had a funny smell, which I quickly realized that it was because it was a Smoking Room. I had specifically requested a Non-Smoking room, and I had researched for hours online, looking for the perfect hotel, and I was really sad when I realized that the room was so terrible. It also had broken furniture, and it was in terrible conditions, it really needed maintenance. I didn't complain at first. I decided that I wouldn't let this ruin my weekend, so we went out and enjoyed the day touring through Madrid. When we came back to the hotel, my boyfriend decided to take a shower, and the shower broke while he was in it. I was furious, and stormed downstairs to the Front Office, demanding that they would give us a different room, but the girl wined that they had none available, and they would only be able to change us to a different room on the next day. I was really mad about this whole situation, but I had no choice but accept it because every other hotel in the area was full as well. The nest day they changed us to a different room, like the ones I had seen on the different websites online, decorated with lighter colors, quite larger that the first one, and without the broken furniture. It even had different amenities, like moisturizing cream samples! I was a lot happier, but still quite upset about what happen the first night. My boyfriend asked, when we were checking out, what type of room they had put us in the first night, and why was it so different from the other, and they said that they were both standard rooms, the only difference was that the first one was a smoking room! If I ever return to Madrid I will definitely chose a different hotel, because there’s a lot to chose from…you don’t have to settle with these kind of hotels that at 10.00pm don’t have anyone one of the maintenance department to assist you in case something breaks down!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for good price!”
Reviews.Author: LucasLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: When we got stuck in Madrid, we decided to book our own hotel via a web site rather than wait 4 hours to get another hotel from Iberia. For EUR 120 per room, this was not cheap, but for a city like Madrid ok. But when we got to the hotel, we realised that this was actually a great price! The rooms are not very big, but very well done, including the bathroom and the beds are just wonderful. The hotel also has a nice lobby and is situated very near the Prado museum and the Atocha railway station. The staff was also very friendly and efficient. So if you look for good value and are willing to pay a bit more than the bare minimum, this is really a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, but don't leave any luggage behind...!”
Reviews.Author: MOandGR
Reviews.Content: We left a couple of items of clothing behind, BIG mistake. We contacted the hotel and asked them to post them to England at our expense, which they declined, on the basis that they didn't take credit cards (two additional family members and the travel company also rang and were given this same message, invariably being told to ring back later). They said that we had to collect the items in person, which is plainly nonsense from an international hotel chain. DHL don't deal with members of the public, so we had to divert back to Madrid on our way home in order to collect them. Overall a great disappointment at such poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: ritafighter
Reviews.Content: Our room had a beautiful view, room was very clean , staff were very helpful. Breakfast is great . Hotel is located 5 minutes to Atocha subway station and also walking distance to Atocha train station that goes to Toledo. Across the hotel you have bars, supermarket, pharmacy , etc... we were also walking distance to prado and Reina Sofia museum. Overall it was a great vacation and I will use NH hotels again .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bradyboy2
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to Madrid.This hotel is in a great location to the main 3 Museums.One can also walk to Plaza Mayor and the Royal Palace. The Breakfast is fine and they give you 15 minutes of free computer use in the Lobby. The room was small but comfortable with a flat screen TV. Staff were helpful although some did not speak much English. As a travel agent I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location if traveling by train or visting one of the art galleries”
Reviews.Author: jumbonav
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location! It is a 5 minute walk from the Atocha train station as well as to several galleries including the Prado. Plenty of nearby cafes and restaurants and a short walk to the beautiful Retiro Park. The staff was nice although I only interfaced with the front desk. The room was nicely appointed and the temperature was good. The negatives: Expensive internet ~18-20 Euro per day, Expensive Breakfast which I did not eat/pay for, lots of street noise due to being on Prado and Atocha streets (and near the train station). Request a room not facing Prado if this is an issue for you. Bottom line: If you need to stay near Atocha station for travel expediency, this is your hotel. If you only have a short time in Madrid and want to hit a gallery, great location. If you have more time in town, there are better options...

Reviews.Title: “Generally good experience”
Reviews.Author: Apollo14
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a good location. Street-facing rooms onto either Paseo del Prado or Calle Atocha are not noisy (at least on and above 4th floor level) Air-conditioning was set at a perfect temperature as Madrid in August is very hot. Staff were friendly and rooms very clean. Small niggles were a lack of hot water on the Saturday evening, though I'm sure this was not a regular occurrence, only one large bath- towel in bathroom but I made do with hand-towels (friends had 2 bath- towels so it is not hotel policy) and shower gel was not replaced for the second day. Small things but necessary in hot weather. All in all it was a good experience and all but the most particular people would enjoy the hotel and its location next to the art galleries and the Retiro Park across the street. Across the street also is Atocha train station for trips to Toledo etc. If not breakfasting in the hotel I would recommend La Plateria about 5 minutes away (turn left out of hotel, walk up Paseo del Prado, turn left onto C/Huertas and you will see it at the V of Moratin and Huertas).

Reviews.Title: “Noisy location for good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elion
Reviews.Content: NH Nacional has a good location just opposite the Prado museum and 2 min.walk from Thyssen-museum. Situated at Paseo del Prado it IS noisy, so ask for a room towards the atrium rather than the street. Well equipped large rooms with aircondition (which is a must in Madrid in summertime!) Closest metro-station is Achecha, 2 mins. away. From there to main-shopping-area it is 3 stops with the metro.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Option if staying in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: newbury2003
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night while visiting Madrid on business. Although my room was a little smaller than expected I was extremely satisfied with all aspects of my stay. The staff were extremely helpful and efficicient, the the room comefortable and the food very agreeable. I'd have no hesitation in recomending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in the NH Nacional”
Reviews.Author: travellingmonkeyhead
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights and had a great time. The room was spacious, with a giant wardrobe, great mirrors and lighting, lots of freebies- shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, toothbrushes, sponge, showercap, shoe buffer, comb, shoe horn & more, there was a fantastic flat screen tv, dressing gowns and slippers to wear, plenty of mirrors, the shower was always hot and extremely powerful. Location is good - right near the retiro park and prado museum - although there are more central hotels. The only negatives would be the size of the bed (pretty small for 2 people - esp since we were in a premium room), the temperature of the room - too warm and unable to cool it down as well as the noisy traffic. Also we never saw a pillow menu as advertised ;) Luckily there was only 1 english channel sky news, otherwise we might have spent longer in the hotel room rather than seeing Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: lovemadrid
Reviews.Content: So there is a fair bit of traffic about, get over it. This is a lovely place to stay, easy to find, well located for getting about by tube, foot whatever 10 mins walk from Gran Via less to main museums. Staff nice and friendly allways willing to help. We speak no spanish but had no problems. Breakfasts nice, good selection. Rooms very nice and comfy. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading”
Reviews.Author: babushkar
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located in a busy area of Madrid. The room size is smaller than I hope for. I was very disappointed that the hotel advertised to have provide free wireless internet access, but that was only for 15 mins on the ground floor by the reception, and so-called "Business Centre". You have to pay 10 Euros per hour in your room with your own laptop and more at the "business centre". On the whole this hotel didnt live up to my expectation, especially after reading from reviews written by other guests. There were always more than two people behind the reception desk but only one speaks good english, and not as friendly and professional as they should be. I will try a perhaps more quieter and more central Location in my next visit to Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mikko77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our Europe vacation. Its located across the street from the Prado museum, kitty corner from the train station -Atocha, has a metro station across the street from it, and it even has a McDonald right next to it. We loved the location of this hotel. It was a 10 mins walk to Puerta Del Sol and 5 min was to the all the bars. The hotel rooms are big for European standards. The room had a very clean bathroom and the room was nicely decorated. I would stay here again with no reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel located at the most noisy spot of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: explorerUtrecht
Reviews.Content: Hotel NH Nacional is a good business class hotel, with good facilities . Although the location of the hotel (opposite the Atocha railway station) is excellent for making trips to villages in the neighbourhood of Madrid (such as El Escorial or Segovia) , as well as for a visit to the Prado, Reina Sophia and Thyssen museums, a problem is that it is located at the busiest roundabout of Madrid. You will hear the combined, continuous noise of about 32 lanes of trafic. The noise if very loud between 6am and 2am (whcih leaves 4 hours of sleep). Hence, don't expect that you can relax in the hotel or get a lot of sleep. NH Hotels probably know this, which is why the hotel is not expensive. Breakfast is excellent (but not cheap!). Because of the noise, I will never select Nh nacional again, despite the moderate bill I received when checking out.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location nice clean rooms great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: francisBelgium
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 nights in june in the nh nacional in madrid and we had a very good time ! first of all for museums you are in the absolute centre ,staff is friendly ,rooms are spacious and clean ,however a bit noisy due to traffic at night; breakfast is very fine and over all very good value for money. We would definetely return there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for museums-deceiving photo”
Reviews.Author: MGB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location walking distance to the three major art museums and there is a subway stop accross the street. The staff was very helpful and fireindly, so much so that when my wife was in the lobby waiting for me she was approached by an unsavery character. The staff noticed and made their presence known to this individual. The rooms are very clean and fairly spacious. My only critisism is that the photo of this hotel does not show the retail stores on the first floor including a McDonalds. I was expecting the entire building to be the hotel and the entrance is not very grand at all. Very reasonably priced though and good value.

Reviews.Title: “OK - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Spencertraveller
Reviews.Content: Nice location, clean room,nice big bed unlike the small beds you get in most EU hotels,good staff. Unless you get a good deal, you can do much better at other hotels in Madrid. The security person at the front of the hotel gives me the creep how he looks at people. Hotel needs to fix that confusing front door entrance - do I use the one to the left or the right and if you are in a whhelchair, you cant get into the hotel. Overall, OK

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks for the NH!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the NH Nacional for 3 nights in March 2003. We were both very happy with the modern decor of the hotel lobby, room and en-suite. It was very comfortable. The location was great - close to the 3 main art museums and some nice local pubs. Great hotel for a relaxing city break. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Spain yesterday. NH Nacional is an average to above average hotel. The best aspect of the hotel is its proximity to the different museums including the Prado, Sofia Reina, and Thyssens -- all which are within walking distance. The rooms were nice and clean. However, the amenities of the hotel were few. It's a good place to sleep and visit Madrid, but not much to do in the hotel itself. I would recommend this hotel to the budget-minded traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our shopping trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Got back last night from two nights at the Nacional. Great modern decor in a lovely old building. Ideal location for exploring Madrid as located close to Museums and shops around Calle Serrano. Fantastic value as booked early with them and got a rate of 97 Euros a night exc breakfast. Ate breakfast one morning in the hotel and it was superb - something for everyone from baby food to diabetic breads to the usual fruits and local specialities. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nacional was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great service, nice staff. Decent price, 150 euros for a double. I would definitely stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Nacional
HotelInfo.Address: Paseo del Prado 48, 28014 Madrid, Spain
